Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2007 06:34PM hopeful47 wrote: Hello Nancy, I believe that only 15% of patients get a complete response (ie all of the tumour is gone from the breast and lymph nodes ) after neoadjuvant chemo, and their future maybe  somewhat better but still at risk for recurrence.  My post op pathology on tumour of 9cm and golf ball sized lymph nodes showed no response whatsoever to chemo, but here I am fine after almost two years.  Someone suggested to me that tumours that disappear with chemo quickly, may infact recur more aggresively because they are eagerly growing at a fast speed, so they "eat" the chemo quickly, die  but then may recur from tiny remnants  quickly as well.  No one really knows  the future, but I would choose to try to be optimistic.  Take care,
